intro: Nicolsonia caffra, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sunlight. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Nicolsonia caffra is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
